poem:
Title: "A Leader's Dawn"

Swinney ascends, a new chapter discloses,
Claiming the helm through the SNP's noses.
Infighting, chaos, a party's lament,
The public ponders 'where our strength went?'
University walls echo his pledge to stand,
One nation's fate in a single hand.
Decisive, firm, in political theatre,
Swinney steps forward, the Scots to cater.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "John Swinney declares ‘new chapter’ as he becomes SNP leader John Swinney declared “a new chapter in our party’s history” as he became leader of the Scottish National party on Monday, but said recent infighting and chaos had left the public “worried about where we are as a party”. Speaking to senior SNP politicians and activists at an event at the University of Glasgow, Swinney said his decision to stand for the role of leader". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
